title: I've just moved from NA to OCE, and want to follow competitive LoL here. Pitch me your team.
body:
Hi, I've been a fan of competitive League of Legends pretty much since the start, but I've never really followed the OCE scene all that closely (although still more than most in NA).  I recently moved to New Zealand, so I want to start following and supporting the OPL more, part of that is having a specific team to support.  Tell me why I should throw all my fan fervor behind your team of choice.

If it informs your pitch at all, I'm a Team Curse turned Team Liquid fan in NA.

replies.body:
I think every team has their own flavour. I find it tough to know who I really follow till I watch their games. 

Here's my own personal take on the teams (and one of the casters will probably tell me how inaccurate i am):

**Legacy:
**
They started out as the classic underdog story because of the great upset against Chiefs back in 2014. 

Watching them you get fiery action and a team that is always improving. Are they really better than Chiefs now? I guess that's what finals are for...

This is a good TLDR: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YSHlEruqrPY

**Chiefs:**

Koyotee who works on our team said this best: 'i don't have to feel bad for supporting Chiefs now' because they were winning all the time for so long.

Every time Chiefs make it internationally I turn into a huge Chiefs fanboy and they hardly ever let you down. 

The exciting thing about watching them is the comebacks. If you look at their record for 2015 you would think they just crush every game, but there were multiple times where they would fall behind and it was poetry in motion watching them claw it back.

**SIN:**

I like the 'SINderella story' pun a little too much. They started off as a scrappy team trying to forge an identity and have dug deep and turned it all around this split. 

Also Juves seems to have almost a cult following. Definitely a team on the rise worth checking out if you like players with lots of personality.

**Dire Wolves:**

I still maintain they have the best logo, but that's maybe because I just think wolves are awesome. They've been around for a while and are usually nipping at the heels of Legacy and Chiefs. 

It wouldn't surprise me if Dire Wolves became the best team in the OPL in a few years.

**Avant:**

The current Avant roster just makes me think players with hearts on their sleeves. They went through some roster changes and are still in the conversation for playoffs.

This is the team to follow if you want to watch a team that is all heart.

**Hellions:**

So much hype coming into the season around their gaming house and bringing talent in from Korea. 

Their games are pretty exciting to watch if maddeningly inconsistent. It feels like if they pull it all together at some point it will be an unstoppable team.

**Infernum:**

This team is the biggest question mark to me. They have so many veterans and a really solid lineup that they could go really far, but they're struggling.

I find their games interesting to watch because Jakattack occasionally just beasts the entire game.

**Trident:**

The fact that Trident are at the bottom of the ladder shows why this OPL split is so fun to watch.

They started off poorly, but the addition of Wzard in the mid lane has turned them into a real threat. They're taking matches of the top teams and upsetting the middle of the packs. 

If the split was a month longer, Trident would be in the conversation for playoffs. This is an exciting team to get on the rollercoaster with.


Again these are just my thoughts and probably way off the mark :)
Jesus, an official Rito response on my stupid post. I really am in an exotic, foreign land.
Welcome to Oceania! I'm from NA myself, so I can't say much about the competitive League of Legends scene in Oceania, but welcome again! ;D

Dire wolves, firstly because supporting legacy or chiefs is just ban wagon jumping on. Second dire wolves sound cool. Third cause sharp, symbol, phantiks, raes and cuden are great names. especially raes :)
I agree and as Sephyre said, we have the best logo ;)
If only the OPL casters could use their inside voice whenever a team fight breaks out. Rito needs to invest in some sort of volume normaliser for them.
